name: Katherine Wolstencroft
content: Life Science Semantics Research Group Life Science Semantics Bioinformatics and Data Science Research@LIACS We do research on knowledge integration & discovery in the life sciences in three main research lines: FAIR Data Ecosystems, Provenance and Reproducible Research, Semantics and Explainable AI. For a list of research papers, please see Google Scholar or LIACS Research A National infrastructure for FAIR bioimaging data and image analyses. A FAIR research commons for Systems and Synthetic Biology FAIR Data for cardiovascular rehabilitation interventions. FAIR sharing of digital health data on virus outbreaks across Africa and Asia Temporal Semantic Similarity The impact of Gene Ontology evolution on omics analysis results Making Sense: Biodiversity Semantic annotation and AI/computer vision for historical biodiversity Hallmarks of Cancer Consensus Consensus Knowledge on Cancer Hallmarks using GO and pathways Huntington's Disease and AI Machine learning and knowledge graphs for HD drug repurposing and disease predictions Provenance in Functional Enrichment A provenance model for FAIR and reproducible functional enrichment > Dr Katy Wolstencroft - Group Leader Dr Rohola Hosseini - Post-Doc Bioimaging Mariam Basajja PhD Candidate Yi Chen - PhD Candidate Dr Lise Stork - Former PhD Candidate External PhD Students Aliya Aktau - LUMC Putu Hadi Purnama Jati - LUMC Samson Johanes - Tilburg University Getu Tadele - Tilburg University
